alert.note: Alert for Pender (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 9:29PM EST until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in North Carolina... Northeast Cape Fear River Near Burgaw affecting Pender County. For the Northeast Cape Fear River...including Burgaw...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northeast Cape Fear River near Burgaw. * WHEN...From this evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Water deepens on the lowest portions of River Bend Road and River Birch Road. At 10.0 feet, Minor flooding of roads in the River Bend and River Birch subdivisions. Flooding of Croomsbridge Road begins west of the bridge over the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Sunday the stage was 3.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.9 feet early Thursday morning. - Advisory stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=ilm . The next statement will be issued by Monday afternoon.
